description.narrative:
CHwB Kosovo har ansökt om kärnstöd till implementeringen av organisationens strategiska plan för 2016-2019. Stödet uppgår till totalt 17 miljoner SEK för perioden 2016-2019.
Insatsens övergripande mål är att skapa förutsättningar och möjligheter för åtnjutandet av kulturell frihet och mångfald. Syftet är också att öka kulturarvets betydelse i arbetet mot att främja mänskliga rättigheter, fredsbyggande processer, försoning och demokratisk utveckling.
Målsättning 1: Stärka samhällets vitalitet samt ansvarsskyldigheten hos duty-bearers. CHwB arbetar med att stärka duty-bearers incitament till att fullfölja deras uppgifter, ansvar och åtaganden. Organisationen stöttar samtidigt civilsamhället genom att stärka deras roll i att påverka och kräva ansvarsskyldighet hos nationella institutioner, synnerligen vad gäller mänskliga rättigheter och kulturarv.
Målsättning 2: Främja samarbetet mellan regioner samt synergier vilka främjar ekonomisk utveckling. Kulturarv ska i större utsträckning användas som ett verktyg för att främja social och ekonomisk utveckling, främst genom att skapa arbetstillfällen, använda lokala resurser och kunskaper samt stötta ett miljömässigt hållbart arbetssätt.
Målsättning 3: CHwB Kosovo som förespråkare av bevarandet av Kosovos kulturarv. CHwB Kosovo är en lokal organisation som har vuxit fram från den svenska organisationen Kulturarv utan Gränser (KuG). Som sådan syftar organisationen till att bevara sin status som en trovärdig röst i arbetet mot att skydda och främja kulturarv i Kosovo, då detta är en värdefull tillgång för samhället i stort.

Core support to Kosovo Foundation for Cultural Heritage without Borders. The overall goal is to create conditions and opportunities for enjoyment of cultural freedom and diversity and for cultural heritage to be increasingly used as a tool to promote human rights. peace-building and democratic development.
CHwB Kosovo has applied to Sida for core support for the implementation of their Strategic Plan for 2016-2019.The total amount for support for the period of 2016-2019 is 17 million SEK.
The overall goal is to create conditions and opportunities for the enjoyment of cultural freedom and cultural diversity and for cultural heritage to be increasingly used as a tool to promote human rights, peace-building and democratic development.
Key objective 1: The vibrancy of community and accountability of duty bearers is strengthened CHwB works to strengthen duty-bearers in fulfilling their obligations and supporting civil society organizations in holding the national institutions accountable to relevant human rights and cultural heritage conventions.
Key objective 2: Fostering territorial cooperation & synergies for economic development Cultural heritage is used as a tool for social and economic development, primarily by creating employment opportunities, utilizing local resources and techniques and supporting environmental sustainability.
Key objective 3: CHwB Kosovo - voice of cultural heritage in Kosovo CHwB Kosovo is the legacy of Swedish Foundation of CHwB. As such it aims to remain as significant and credible voice of protection and promotion of cultural heritage in Kosovo, as a public common good belonging to all communities

tag.narrative: 11.4 - Strengthen efforts to protect and safeguard the world’s cultural and natural heritage.
11.4 - Stärka insatserna för att skydda och trygga världens kultur- och naturarv.

description.narrative: Key observations noted in the narrative report during 2019 are: - Preparation and presentation of two research reports about the impact of creative industries in the economic development for six western municipalities in Kosovo and budgetary analysis for the cultural sector in those municipalities. The joint action plan for the western part of Kosovo could not be implemented, so this activity is postponed to 2020. - Creation of Priority lists of projects for Cultural Heritage for the three border municipalities in Kosovo and three in North Macedonia and restoration of six CH sites. This project strengthens the cross-border cooperation between Kosovo and North Macedonia. All the planning, projection and implementation work is done on inclusive, transparent and participatory process by creation of Cultural Heritage Forums in each municipality - consisting of local and central officials, civil society organizations and other active organizations in the field of local development. - Heritage Space Platform 2019 resulted on development of ten projects into cultural artworks, services, online platforms, books and storytelling materials. Nine out of ten beneficiaries selected were women. - Five Heritage camps were organized and 84 participants - young professionals (59 women and 25 men) benefited with lectures and hands-on trainings about restauration and conservation in the heritage sites. - Restoration of two kulla houses in the Western part of Kosovo. - Restoration, rehabilitation and beautification plans for 16 cultural heritage sites under the project 'Inter-community dialogue through inclusive cultural heritage preservation'. Sites are selected in cooperation with municipalities, communities, religious leaders and other relevant stakeholders. As a result of discussions with Sida during previous years, CHwB Kosovo has started to report also on the results concerning cross cutting issues such as: - Work with communities to recover their sense of dignity and inspire them to be active promoters of their rights on cultural heritage - Increase transparency and accountability of cultural institutions and engagement of local communities - Inclusive access to cultural heritage sites regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, physical or intellectual abilities - Enhancing gender equality with women’s empowerment - Environmental and conflicts perspectives.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
